required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Birth on Immunological Parameters in Cord Blood
clinical_study.official_title: To Investigate the Immediate Effect of Birth on Immunological Parameters in Cord Blood, and Compare With Data of CS Born Infants Collected in the JULIUS SN Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Danone Asia Pacific Holdings Pte, Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Danone Asia Pacific Holdings Pte, Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to understand the immediate effect of birth on immunological parameters in vaginally born cord blood.

detailed_description.textblock: The main purpose of the study is to understand the immediate effect of birth on immunological parameters in vaginally born cord blood and also whether mode and duration of delivery has an influence on immune parameters in cord blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Cytokines profile in cord blood plasma
primary_outcome.description: Following cytokines will be part of the profile: IL-6, IL-1, IL-2, IL-4, IL-5, IL-7, IL-8, IL-10, IL12p70, IL-13, IL-17, G-CSF, GM-CSF, IFNg, MCP-1(MCAF), MIP-1b, TNFa
Immunoglobulin levels will be measured in cord blood plasma

primary_outcome.measure: Allergen stimulated cytokine expression in the supernatants of Cord blood mononuclear cells (CBMC)
primary_outcome.description: Cellular response to allergen stimulation will be measured in supernatants

intervention.intervention_name: This is not an interventional study

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant mothers undergoing normal vaginal delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant mothers undergoing normal vaginal delivery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) 2 weeks prior to birth
- Antenatal antibiotics treatment (2 weeks prior to birth)
- Diabetes mellitus requiring insulin treatment during pregnancy
- Uncontrollable Hyperthyroidism during pregnancy
